type: Flood Hazard Modelling Sensitivity Pilot Study
short_summary: Study to examine uncertainty in flood hazard mapping project
description: Expecting a Contractor to conduct a study on uncertainty in all steps of a flood hazard mapping project, and the corresponding effect on the final flood map. The outcome of the study will provide a better understanding of the impacts of decisions made throughout flood hazard analysis projects, and which steps in the analysis have the greatest impact on the final result.
full_summary:
# Flood Hazard Modelling Sensitivity Pilot Study
## Title - Étude pilote sur la sensibilité de la modélisation des aléas d'inondation

### Government Tender Announcement Reference
Reference Number: cb-490-33913396
Amendment Number: 9
Solicitation Number: 5000074864
Document Type: Request for Proposal (RFP)
Tender Status: Expiré (Expired)
### Tender Details
Tender Closing Date: 2024-01-26T14:00:00
Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-02-08
Expected Contract End Date: 2024-09-07

### Service and Goods Requirements
The solicitation is seeking a contractor to conduct a sensitivity study of flood hazard mapping, specifically assessing uncertainty in all steps of the project and its impact on the final flood map. The primary objective is to provide a better understanding of the consequences of decisions made during flood hazard analysis and to identify the most impactful steps in the analysis process.
### Procurement Information
Procurement Category: SRV
Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
Trade Agreements: *Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
*Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
*Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
*Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
Note: Trade Agreements may apply; please refer to the solicitation documents for details.
